title: Chapter 15 â€“ Practice: Classes and Objects
description: Hands-on missions for chapter 15 defining simple classes, creating objects, and using attributes and methods.

solution.notes: Learner should define a Book class with title and pages attributes, an __init__ method, and a description() method that returns a string like 'Title (X pages)'.
Learner should implement a Player class with name and score, methods add_score(points) and reset_score(), and demonstrate updating and printing the score.
Learner should create a Pet class with name and hunger attributes, methods feed(amount) and status(), and show how hunger changes and affects status messages.
Learner should add a __str__ method to a simple class so that printing the object shows a friendly summary string.

Learner should build FirewallRule and Firewall classes, store a list of rules, loop over them in Firewall.check, and return 'ALLOW' or 'BLOCK' depending on whether any rule matches the given IP and port.
Learner should implement Attempt and Vault classes, track failed attempts in a list, lock the vault after too many failures, and show how the state changes over time.
Learner should implement Node and Network classes, store nodes in a list, find nodes by name, and simulate pinging between them with different online/offline states.
Learner should implement Process and SecurityMonitor classes, add processes to a list, filter high-risk ones with high_risk_processes(min_risk), and print warnings for them.
Learner should create Code and CodeBreaker classes, call methods between objects, track attempts, and stop when the code is guessed correctly.
